title: Are there differences between staff groups in report being ill due to work related stress?
analysis_commentary: The survey findings on staff reporting work related stress can be broken down according to disability â€“ and show that staff with disability reports a consistently higher level of illness due to work related stress. The survey also reveals that more females report being ill due to work related stress compared to men; in 2013, 39% of females compared to 35% of male staff report being ill due to work related stress. (data not shown).
data_source: Department of Health, Survey of NHS Staff
